result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig A Huefner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber granted under jail rules.

records.addlTxt: Loss of 2 days good time due to violations.
Columbia County Court Conviction DNA - DNA taken

Defendant, Craig A Huefner, appeared pro se. Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the right to an attorney. Defendant waived attorney. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 10 days jail start Oct. 16, 2015 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules.  $443 costs, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. No jail credit.

Prior: 703 E Wisconsin Street #5, Portage, WI 53901

Defendant, Craig A Huefner, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $150.00 sign bond, defendant's d/o/b is 6/5/85,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 03:20 pm.  Return date scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
